DOC.brief_summary: To compare the efficacy and safety of celecoxib versus ibuprofen in subjects with osteoarthritis (OA) of the knee.
DOC.brief_title: Efficacy and Safety of Celecoxib Versus Ibuprofen in the Treatment of Osteoarthritis of the Knee (United States)
DOC.criteria: Aged >= 40 years old Diagnosed with OA of the knee according to the American College of Rheumatology and OA in flare state at baseline visit Functional capacity class of IIII Inflammatory arthritis or gout or pseudogout with acute flare within the past 2 years (subjects with fibrositis or fibromyalgia will not be excluded) Acute joint trauma at index joint within the past 3 months with active symptoms Score of >=20 on PHQ9 or score of >=1 on PHQ9 item i Use of mobility assisting device for <6 weeks or use of walker
